snippet: Is a final four of Novak Djokovic, Andy Murray, Tomas Berdych and David Ferrer indicative of the A.T.P.’s depth, or a sign that the Big Three’s stranglehold has weakened?
abstract: Greg Bishop On Tennis column notes that of men's tennis's Big Three--Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic--only Djokovic will appear in the semifinals at the United States Open, suggesting that their stranglehold on the sport is weakening; Andy Murray, Tomas Berdych and David Ferrer round out the semis.
lead_paragraph: Is a final four of Novak Djokovic, Andy Murray, Tomas Berdych and David Ferrer indicative of the A.T.P.’s depth, or a sign that the Big Three’s stranglehold has weakened?

headline.print_headline: Questions Atop Men’s Game As Big Three Thins to Djokovic
headline.seo: Big Three Is Down to Djokovic, Raising Questions Atop Men’s Tennis
headline.main: Questions Atop Men’s Game as Big Three Thins to Djokovic
